item.title: Overgrown bush and litter, 11th January
item.description:
There is part of a trolly in a blackberry bush right outside the front of birdsall. The bush makes it hard to park/ exit vehicles and needs to be cut back. There is part of a trolley in there. Itâ€™s been there for many months so would be great for this to be tidied and removed.

item.title: Lampost/lights on stairs not working., 11th January
item.description:
The Streetlight at the top of the stairs leading from Marine Drive down to Gorman Road is not working, and the lights along the wall of the stairs are also out. Took a photo of the streetlight on Saturday 10th January about 6pm and you can see how dark the area is. This is a safety hazard when going up and down stairs.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Marine Drive, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole in road outside number 54, 11th January
item.description:
This pothole has been filled last year but has reappeared in the last few weeks after the cold weather conditions. It is shedding fragments of tarmac every time a vehicle goes over it, causing a problem for the vehicles and a danger to the pedestrians.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 56, Barnfield Wood Road, Park Langley, Greater London

item.title: Slip hazard leaves and damage to pavements and fence line, 11th January
item.description:
For the last 10 years I have had to use my personal garden waste bin to clear the leaves that fall from the Council's tree at the location identified since the leaves collect on the pavement against the fence of my property but whilst I wait for a few months to see if the Council will clear at the same time they clear the highway the pavement never gets cleared and therefore creates a slip hazard - the leaves also create damage to my fence since they collect on the pavement against the fence. Also the tree has gotten to a size where it creates damage to the pavement due to its roots, meaning it is uneven and also the boundary walls of my property. I think the tree should either be removed or have the roots cut and entirely removed where they come up to my adjoining property.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Petts Wood Road, Poverest, Orpington, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
